intro: Neurolaena jannaweissana, commonly known as the white-flowered false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, white to pale yellow flowers with five petals, often adorned with distinctive markings. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a rough texture and prominent veins. Neurolaena jannaweissana is typically found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woodlands.
